### Objectives

+ In this module, you will learn  how to
  + Retrieve a limited number of fields
  + Retrieve distinct values
  + Change field names

### SQL keywords

+ Here are the SQL keywords introduced in this module:
  + as
  + from
  + select

### Datasets used in this module

This page provides a bit more details about the database used in this module. Please note that there might be small inconsistencies between the Oracle version and the SQLite version of the data.

+ Airlines
  + Data dictionary. Available in [text format](`r git`data/airlines-data-dictionary.txt)
  + Oracle: no download needed
  + SQLite: download this file. Available in [binary format](`r git`data/airlines_db.sqlite).
  + You should not need it, but there is a backup of this data available in [CSV format](`r git`data/airlines.csv).

+ Crawling
  + Data dictionary. Available in [text format](`r git`data/crawling-data-dictionary.txt)
  + Oracle: no download needed
  + SQLite: download this file. Available in [binary format](`r git`data/crawling_db.sqlite).
  + You should not need it, but there is a backup of this data available in [CSV format](`r git`data/crawling.csv).

+ Hospital
  + Data dictionary. Available in [text format](`r git`data/hospital-data-dictionary.txt)
  + Oracle: no download needed
  + SQLite: download this file. Available in [binary format](`r git`data/hospital_db.sqlite).
  + You should not need it, but there is a backup of this data available in [CSV format](`r git`data/hospital.csv).

+ Patient_type
  + Data dictionary. Available in [text format](`r git`data/hospital-data-dictionary.txt)
  + Oracle: no download needed
  + SQLite: download this file. Available in [Not available yet](`r git`data/patient_db.sqlite).
  + You should not need it, but there is a backup of this data available in [Not available yet](`r git`data/patient.csv).
